channel.title: Which is better?
channel.description: I persoanlly think Mozilla Firefox 2.0 is the best. I currently have Seamonkey, Mozilla Firefox 1.5, Internet Explorer 6, Internet Explroer, and I'm getting ready to get Opera, and possibly, Netscape.

item.title: Which is better?
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

Fasterfox just made my firefox slower. It was already a speed demon beofre I installed Fasterfox, now its slower than the ancient IE 1.0 =[br][size=1]Posted at: November 09, 2006, 05:31:56 PM[/size][hr]Darnit, now I gotta do the procedure in Ron’s tut all over again. :([br][size=1]Posted at: November 09, 2006, 05:33:44 PM[/size][hr]K, made it faster again, heres the tut for those people who really wanna speed up their Firefox…

[quote=“sk84lifesam, post:1, topic:4535”]this makes it go alot faster yay my second tut today XD

  1. Type “about:config” into the address bar and press enter. Scroll down and look for the following entries:

network.http.pipelining
network.http.proxy.pipelining
network.http.pipelining.maxrequests

Normally the browser will make one request to a web page at a time. When you enable pipelining it will make several at once, which really speeds up page loading.

  1. Alter the entries as follows: (by double clicking them)

Set “network.http.pipelining” to “true”

Set “network.http.proxy.pipelining” to “true”

Set "network.http.pipelining.maxrequests " to some number like 30. This means it will make 30 requests at once. (I changed mine to 100, works great.)

  1. Lastly right-click anywhere and select New-> Integer. Name it “nglayout.initialpaint.delay” and set its value to “0”. This value is the amount of time the browser waits before it acts on information it recieves

based on this tutorial http://www.dommox.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=356[/quote]

I set it to 37 Now its a speed demon

Read full topic

item.title: Which is better?
item.dc:creator: @blacker blacker
item.description:
@blacker wrote:

Btw, the people who think Seamonkey is faster than FF are totally wrong. It takes around 2 secs for Seamonkey to load the board after I post, whereas Firefox takes about a quarter of a second. The people who think Firefox sucks or is slow, might be just under the minimal reuqirements for your computer to run it, but not enough to not be able to run it. I’m not saying this is correct, it’s just a guess.[br][size=1]Posted at: November 07, 2006, 08:49:49 PM[/size][hr][quote=“Death_666, post:5, topic:23063”]what website? =] i would like to try this out[/quote] I dont remember, there was a tutorial on it in the tutorials tips tricks and tweaks board, and I tihk its on the list. runs over to the tutorial to make his firefox 2.0 as fast as his 1.5.07
